name: Bar Di Maria Agata
short_desc: Small espresso bar in the Ballarò market, popular with locals.
tucci_story: The smell of market produce and roasting beans collide each morning.

name: Ideal Caffè Stagnitta
short_desc: Historic coffee house since 1922, near Discesa dei Giudici.
tucci_story: Sit down, feel wood-panels and espresso with decades of Palermo life.

name: Pasticceria Cappello
short_desc: Famous for Setteveli cake and other chocolate classics.
tucci_story: Sweet ambition wrapped in Sicilian precision.

name: Pasticceria Costa
short_desc: Iconic pastry shop known for cassata and cannoli.
tucci_story: The kind of sugar that should be served with confession.

name: Caffè del Kassaro
short_desc: Tiny espresso bar at the edge of Vucciria market.
tucci_story: The coffee is rough, real, and better for it.

name: Antico Caffè Spinnato
short_desc: Historic 1860 café serving pastries and gelato.
tucci_story: Marble tables, sugar, and slow conversation — Palermo’s heartbeat.

name: Caffè Vabres
short_desc: Classic café by the botanical gardens with sweet pastries.
tucci_story: Morning light, ricotta, and espresso — a small symphony.

name: Caffè Santoro
short_desc: Local café opposite the cathedral.
tucci_story: Bells ring, spoons clink — faith and caffeine intertwined.

name: Caffetteria L’Anciova
short_desc: Small modern espresso stop with outdoor tables.
tucci_story: New machines, old manners, and perfect crema.

name: Bar Rosanero
short_desc: Local haunt of Palermo football fans, simple and proud.
tucci_story: Coffee, pride, and arguments — the city distilled.

name: Trattoria Corona
short_desc: Family-run seafood trattoria—local favourite.
tucci_story: Smiles, sea air and pasta like you used to eat at grandma’s house.

name: Le Angeliche
short_desc: Bistro in Ballarò market run by four young Sicilian women.
tucci_story: Fresh market produce meets bold female-energy in the kitchen.

name: Trattoria Trapani
short_desc: Simple trattoria with pasta & fish near the center.
tucci_story: Honest food that tastes like someone’s grandmother still runs the kitchen.

name: Trattoria Da Pino
short_desc: Well known for generous Sicilian home-cooking.
tucci_story: Share a table with strangers — that’s Palermo hospitality.

name: Osteria Ballarò
short_desc: Modern trattoria inside a restored stable.
tucci_story: Old stones, new flavors — Sicily reinvented without apology.

name: Trattoria Da Salvo
short_desc: Crowded, loud, joyful — pasta con le sarde done right.
tucci_story: The waiters argue like family, and maybe they are.

name: Osteria Alivàru
short_desc: Contemporary Sicilian kitchen with strong local roots.
tucci_story: Seasonal dishes that taste of soil, sea and generational love.

name: Da Mimmo
short_desc: Cosy family trattoria serving pasta alla Norma and grilled meats.
tucci_story: Noise, laughter, and the perfume of frying eggplant.

name: Trattoria della Pergola
short_desc: Tiny place with no menu — the chef cooks what’s fresh.
tucci_story: You eat what’s on his mind today, and that’s how it should be.

name: Corona Trattoria
short_desc: Seafood trattoria near market, affordable and local.
tucci_story: The floor creaks, the plates sing, the wine forgives everything.

name: Ceramiche Tre Erre
short_desc: Hand-painted Sicilian ceramics from local workshop.
tucci_story: Colourful clay telling centuries-old stories with stubborn artistry.

name: Shahidi Ceramics & Carpets
short_desc: Workshop & shop of handmade ceramics & textiles since 1987.
tucci_story: Tradition woven in cloth, shaped in clay with pride.

name: Fratelli Battaglia Spices
short_desc: Old dried-fruit and spice store near the markets.
tucci_story: Almonds, cinnamon, and memory in the air.

name: Edizioni Precarie
short_desc: Stationery store making notebooks from recycled market paper.
tucci_story: Paper that smells faintly of oranges and rebellion.

name: Patrizia Italiano
short_desc: Ceramic artist blending folklore and modern design.
tucci_story: Clay that laughs in Sicilian dialect.

name: Antica Drogheria del Capo
short_desc: Old grocery with herbs, nuts, spices and dried fruits.
tucci_story: The air smells of cinnamon, almonds, and time.

name: Casa Stagnone
short_desc: Local products, wine and preserves from western Sicily.
tucci_story: Glass jars catching the last light of the island.

name: Creazioni Siciliane di Mimì
short_desc: Boutique for linen, embroidery and ceramics.
tucci_story: Fabric and clay whispering the same stubborn melody.

name: La Bottega del Pastaio
short_desc: Artisan shop with handmade pasta and local delicacies.
tucci_story: You can smell the wheat and olive oil in the packaging.

name: Stagnitta Caffè Roastery
short_desc: Old-school coffee roaster near Quattro Canti.
tucci_story: The air hums with caffeine and nostalgia.

name: Caffè Morettino
short_desc: Family-run roaster since 1920, blends inspired by Palermo.
tucci_story: Coffee that knows its roots and refuses shortcuts.

name: Tostadora Santoro
short_desc: Micro-roastery near the beach producing single-origin beans.
tucci_story: The sea breeze carries the roast like a quiet promise.

name: Caffè Vergnano Palermo
short_desc: Branch of the historic Turin roaster, locally managed.
tucci_story: Polished espresso without losing its soul.

name: Bar Garibaldi Blend
short_desc: Micro-blend espresso shop near Piazza Garibaldi.
tucci_story: A one-man crusade against mediocrity in a demitasse.

name: Caffè Lumia
short_desc: Modern café roasting small-batch beans from Ethiopia & Brazil.
tucci_story: Fruity notes, jazz on vinyl, and a stubborn sense of calm.

name: Officine Caffè
short_desc: Coffee lab blending Sicilian and South American beans.
tucci_story: Science meets warmth in a city that prefers chaos.

name: Torrefazione Sicilia Centro
short_desc: Neighborhood roaster known for dark, bold profiles.
tucci_story: The beans crackle like street voices at dawn.

name: Caffè Barbera
short_desc: Historic brand roasting since 1870, small Palermo outlet.
tucci_story: Coffee with a memory older than most buildings around it.

name: Caffè del Duomo
short_desc: Espresso bar facing Piazza del Duomo.
tucci_story: The bar hums while Mount Etna watches silently from afar.

name: Pasticceria Savia
short_desc: Legendary bakery since 1897, known for arancini and cannoli.
tucci_story: Where breakfast means deep-fried theology.

name: Caffè Europa
short_desc: Elegant café with marble counters and late-night gelato.
tucci_story: The espresso carries a faint echo of the 1960s.

name: Caffè Sesto Senso
short_desc: Modern spot for cappuccino and pastries near the fish market.
tucci_story: The smell of sugar battles the scent of the sea.

name: Caffè Prestipino
short_desc: Old pastry shop with baroque décor and famous cassata.
tucci_story: A slice of sugar-laden history behind glass.

name: Pasticceria Continella
short_desc: Family bakery specializing in marzipan and almond sweets.
tucci_story: Sicily’s past and present held together with sugar glue.

name: Insigne Caffè
short_desc: Specialty coffee bar with micro-roaster and pour-overs.
tucci_story: Foam art meets volcanic precision.

name: Tramontana Caffè
short_desc: Tiny café tucked between churches on the baroque street.
tucci_story: You sip quietly; bells ring above.

name: Bar Spinella
short_desc: Local icon facing Villa Bellini gardens.
tucci_story: Granita, brioche, gossip, and the hum of scooters.

name: Caffè Parisi
short_desc: Elegant coffee house with terrace and fine pastries.
tucci_story: The clatter of porcelain sounds almost aristocratic.

name: Trattoria Da Antonio
short_desc: Seafood trattoria hidden near the fish market.
tucci_story: The smell of lemon, garlic, and the day’s catch fills the alley.

name: Osteria Antica Marina
short_desc: Beloved spot for fresh fish and pasta alla Norma.
tucci_story: Plates as honest as the fishermen who supply them.

name: Trattoria U Fucularu
short_desc: Classic osteria with wood-grilled meats and wine.
tucci_story: Smoke, laughter, and pork ribs — all equally loud.

name: Trattoria Dal Pescatore
short_desc: Unpretentious seafood place with handwritten menu.
tucci_story: Fish, lemon, and opinion — all served fresh daily.

name: Osteria Antica Rosa
short_desc: Simple local kitchen with seasonal produce.
tucci_story: Plates that taste like they were made to feed friends, not customers.

name: Trattoria Casalinga
short_desc: Family-style spot serving pasta alla Norma and involtini.
tucci_story: You come for lunch and leave adopted.

name: Locanda Cerami
short_desc: Youthful osteria serving Sicilian tapas and wine.
tucci_story: The street smells of basil and ambition.

name: Osteria Antica Locanda
short_desc: Warm, narrow trattoria with brick walls and seafood focus.
tucci_story: You forget time; the wine remembers for you.

name: Il Borgo di Federico
short_desc: Mid-century trattoria famous for pizza and pasta alla Norma.
tucci_story: Families eat, argue, and pass plates across generations.

name: Ristorante Me Cumpari Turiddu
short_desc: Stylish trattoria celebrating Sicilian grandma recipes.
tucci_story: The past served with better wine and lighting.
